quest.name: A Tale of a Tail
journal:
î‚¾ Quest Sync
Kenn Beq is feeling every one of his years.
objectives: Slay a green glider for its tail.
Deliver the green glider tail to Kenn Beq.

dialogue.name: KENNBEQ
dialogue.text: Ah, if it isn't a young one, fairly bursting with vigor. Will you not hear the plea of this tired old amaro?

dialogue.name: KENNBEQ
dialogue.text: To the south of Wolekdorf, there abide winged lizards known as green gliders. I would be grateful if you hunt one and bring me its tail.

dialogue.name: KENNBEQ
dialogue.text: As many winters as I've seen, I no longer have the agility to chase them down. Rest assured you will not go unrewarded for your troubles.

dialogue.name: KENNBEQ
dialogue.text: Green gliders are known to inhabit the area to the south of here. If you could bring me its tail, I would be grateful.

dialogue.name: KENNBEQ
dialogue.text: Ah, the young one returns from the hunt.

dialogue.name: KENNBEQ
dialogue.text: Oho, such a plump, juicy tail this is! Thank you, thank you. These are a favorite of mine.

dialogue.name: KENNBEQ
dialogue.text: Before I came to be here, I was in Lakeland. There I lived amidst men for many years.

dialogue.name: KENNBEQ
dialogue.text: In the time before the Flood, a great battle was joined at the Source. With my master upon my back, I charged into the fray against the forces of the Shadowkeeper.

dialogue.name: KENNBEQ
dialogue.text: Countless many fell that day. Though I was fortunate to escape with my life, I did not escape wholly unscathed, taking grievous wounds at the hands of enemy soldiers who had assumed wolflike forms.

dialogue.name: KENNBEQ
dialogue.text: Such were my injuries, it was believed I would never walk again, never mind fly. Yet my master never forsook me. He nursed me back to health, feeding me a nutritious diet of green glider tails, and I eventually made a full recovery.

dialogue.name: KENNBEQ
dialogue.text: Seeing the tail now, I cannot help but be reminded of those golden days. The days I spent with the elvenfolk. Thank you, young one, for giving me the chance to relive them.
